key_insight: MAMA-Memeia decomposes depressive-symptom detection in memes into multiple specialized agents (visual, textual, symptom-oriented) that collaborate, and introduces RESTOREx as a dedicated resource to improve symptom-level identification in multimodal memes.
problem_solved: Identifies nuanced depressive symptoms expressed through the combination of image and text in memes â€” a multimodal, symptom-granular detection task that standard classifiers struggle to capture.
method: Multi-aspect decomposition: separate agents analyze image cues, embedded text, and symptom-specific signals for focused feature extraction.
Multi-agent collaboration: agents exchange hypotheses and are ensembled/aggregated to produce interpretable symptom-level labels.
Resource & LLM support: introduces RESTOREx (a symptom-labeled meme resource) and leverages LLM-guided annotation/coordination to improve labeling quality and model supervision.
impact: Provides a modular, interpretable pipeline and a specialized dataset that enable AI/ML practitioners to build more accurate, symptom-aware detectors for mental-health signals in social media memes, facilitating safer and more responsible monitoring tools.
visual_elements: Pipeline diagram showing multi-aspect agents (image agent, text agent, symptom agent) and their communication/aggregation into final labels.
Before-and-after annotated meme examples highlighting detected symptoms and the cues used (text spans, visual regions).
Bar chart or heatmap of symptom prevalence in RESTOREx to show distribution and coverage.
Architecture sketch showing RESTOREx, LLM-assisted annotation loop, and final model training/deployment flow.
paper_title: MAMA-Memeia! Multi-Aspect Multi-Agent Collaboration for Depressive Symptoms Identification in Memes
paper_authors: Siddhant Agarwal, Adya Dhuler, Polly Ruhnke, Melvin Speisman, Md Shad Akhtar
